alert.note: Alert for Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 12:16PM EST until December 22 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Kennebec and Sagadahoc Counties. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Somerset and Kennebec Counties. Sandy River At Mercer affecting Somerset and Franklin Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Augusta. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Several businesses along Front Street in downtown Augusta suffer basement flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:48 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 24.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 26.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall below flood stage Thursday evening to 9.5 feet Friday morning then rise again. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
